awd_titl_txt: Acquisition and Processing of AVHRR Images During JGOFS
awd_abstract_narration: A station to receive, archive and process high resolution images                from the NOAA polar-orbiting satellites will be installed on                    board the R/V Thompson and operated during the JGOFS cruises.                   Images of sea surface temperature will be generated and will be                 accessible on the ship to support field studies requiring real-                 time satellite coverage.  After post-cruise quality control, the                images will be published on CD-ROMs for distribution to all JGOFS               investigators.                                                                                                                                                  A domain extending from 12.5oS to 12.5oN and 130oW to 145oW will                be covered.  Processes that can be observed in this domain                      include the upwelling tongue along the equator and the                          Intertropical Convergence Zone at 8oN.  The data will be used for               statistical studies of the formation, evolution and decay of                    surface temperature patterns, as well as for process-oriented                   studies for which simultaneous shipboard sampling is available.
